Core Calculate Soil Temperature Function

Source: R/TsoilFunctions.R
soil_temperature_function.Rd

Function called to calculate soil temperature from W.A. Beckman and Porter (1973) . Param are passed as a list to facilitating solving the equations. This function is not intended to be called directly. Energy balance equations from Porter et al. (1973) and Kingsolver (1979)

soil_temperature_function(j, T_so, params)

Arguments

j

numeric is the number of the iteration of running the model.
T_so

numeric is the initial soil temperature profile in C.
params

is a list containing the following param, which are described or calculated in soil_temperature: list(SSA, epsilon_so, k_so, c_so, dz, z_r, z0, H, T_a, u, rho_a, rho_so, c_a, TimeIn, dt, shade).

Value

Soil temperature profile as a list.

References

Kingsolver JG (1979). “Thermal and hydric aspects of environmental hetergeneity in the pitcher plant mosquito.” Ecological Monographys, 49, 357--376.

Porter WP, Mitchell JW, Bekman A, DeWitt CB (1973). “Behavioral implications of mechanistic ecology: thermal and behavioral modeling of desert ectotherms and their microenvironments.” Oecologia, 13, 1--54.

W.A. Beckman JWM, Porter WP (1973). “Thermal Model for Prediction of a Desert Iguana㤼㸲s Daily and Seasonal Behavior.” J. Heat Transfer, 95(2), 257--262. doi: 10.1115/1.3450037 , https://asmedigitalcollection.asme.org/heattransfer/article-abstract/95/2/257/416609/Thermal-Model-for-Prediction-of-a-Desert-Iguana-s?redirectedFrom=fulltext.

See also

Other soil temperature functions: soil_conductivity(), soil_specific_heat(), soil_temperature_equation(), soil_temperature_integrand(), soil_temperature()

Author

Joseph Grigg

Examples

  set.seed(123)
  temp_vector       <- runif(96, min = -10, max = 10)
  wind_speed_vector <- runif(96, min = 0, max = 0.4)
  time_vector       <- rep(1:24, 4)
  solrad_vector     <- rep(c(rep(0, 6), 
                             seq(10, 700, length.out = 6), 
                             seq(700, 10, length.out = 6), 
                             rep(0, 6)),
                           4)
  params            <- list(SSA        = 0.7, 
                            epsilon_so = 0.98, 
                            k_so       = 0.293, 
                            c_so       = 800, 
                            dz         = 0.05, 
                            z_r        = 1.5, 
                            z0         = 0.02, 
                            H          = solrad_vector, 
                            T_a        = temp_vector, 
                            u          = wind_speed_vector, 
                            rho_a      = 1.177, 
                            rho_so     = 1620,
                            c_a        = 1006, 
                            TimeIn     = time_vector, 
                            dt         = 60 * 60, 
                            shade      = FALSE)

soil_temperature_function(j      = 1, 
                          T_so   = rep(20,13), 
                          params = params)

#> [[1]]
#>  [1] -32.87361   0.00000   0.00000   0.00000   0.00000   0.00000   0.00000
#>  [8]   0.00000   0.00000   0.00000   0.00000   0.00000   0.00000
#>
